iti41:1.1: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
iti41:2.1: “Those sentient beings are truly bereft, mendicants, who are bereft of noble wisdom.
iti41:2.2: They live unhappily in the present life—with distress, anguish, and fever—
iti41:2.3: and when the body breaks up, after death, they can expect a bad rebirth.
iti41:2.4: Those sentient beings are not bereft who are not bereft of noble wisdom.
iti41:2.5: In the present life they’re happy—free of anguish, distress, and fever—
iti41:2.6: and when the body breaks up, after death, they can expect a good rebirth.”
iti41:2.7: That is what the Buddha said.
iti41:4.1: Wisdom is best in the world,
iti41:4.4: the ending of rebirth and continued existence.
iti41:6.1: This too was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.
